questionListItems.title: Will my child be forced to go through an activity that he/she is not confident in?

answer.body: OBS Instructors are trained to motivate and provide a supportive environment for the participants. Your child will not be forced to participate in any activity and will not be asked to engage in an activity without safety briefings and orientation. However, he/she will be strongly encouraged to participate in all activities during the Programme and at a level that he/she is comfortable with. This is to maximise the opportunities for learning and self-discovery, in alignment with the philosophy of ‚Äòchallenge-by-choice‚Äô.

questionListItems.title: Where will these activities be conducted?

answer.body: Different activities will be conducted on mainland Singapore and/or Pulau Ubin. The OBS Programme is designed such that despite the different types of activities, students can achieve the same learning outcomes.

questionListItems.title: What happens if my child has their period during the Course? Can they still go through the water activities?

answer.body: Your child can still participate in all activities. Female participants who are expecting their period during the programme should bring an extra supply of sanitary pads, dark-coloured shorts/pants, and extra plastic bags for the disposal of soiled sanitary pads. There is no requirement for them to take any medication to delay or postpone their menstruation cycle, unless otherwise stated by their doctor. Additionally, they can approach any female OBS Instructor for assistance during the Course.

questionListItems.title: Will I be informed if my child is injured/unwell?

answer.body: At first instance of receiving a report of an injury/illness, OBS will assess, manage and monitor. Medical treatment will be given by the Instructor and/or our qualified OBS nurses for the well-being of your child. You will be informed if your child requires further medical attention at a clinic or hospital. If, after a period of rest and monitoring, the nurses and Instructors assess your child to be fit to re-join the Course, you will not be informed.

questionListItems.title: If my child is unwell or injured during the Programme, do I need to pick my child up? What if I cannot pick my child up?

answer.body: If your child is sent to a clinic or hospital for further diagnosis or treatment, you may need to pick him/her up if the doctor issues him/her a medical certificate (MC), as it is best recommended for any injured student to rest at home. We do not encourage your child to continue with the Course. If your child is ill, we may ask that you pick your child up to see a doctor. In both cases, your child will benefit from the comfort of your presence, and it is best for him/her to be brought home to rest, after seeking medical advice. If you are unable to pick your child up, you can arrange for another family member above 18 years old to do so on your behalf or request for assistance from the school.

questionListItems.title: How do I contact my child in the event of a family emergency?

answer.body: You may contact your child via the Teacher Coordinator. However, due to the expeditionary nature of the course, we seek your understanding that some time is needed for OBS to reach your child. In addition, do note that your child‚Äôs mobile phone will also be kept by OBS to ensure the security of personal items and minimal distraction during the Course.

questionListItems.title: I do not have a SingPass. How do I register my child for the programme?

answer.body: You may register for a SingPass via https://www.singpass.gov.sg/home/ui/register/instructions. The link also provides responses for other related SingPass queries.

questionListItems.title: What if I did not receive an acknowledgement email from OBS after I have submitted the form online?

answer.body: Please inform the school through your child‚Äôs teacher if you have submitted the e-Registration Form, but did not receive an acknowledgement email from OBS. Your child‚Äôs teacher will check in with OBS and advise you on how to proceed.

questionListItems.title: What if nationwide situations that impact your child's participation arise?

answer.body: In the event of a nationwide situation that impacts your child‚Äôs participation (e.g., haze, new COVID variant), MOE and OBS will provide timely updates to schools. MOE & OBS will take reference from national agencies and apply the relevant requirements to the Programme. During this time, if you have other questions regarding OBS, please check with OBS at OBS_Programmes@nyc.gov.sg

questionListItems.title: Why is tetanus vaccination required for attending the course?

answer.body: Tetanus is a disease caused by the bacteria, Clostridium tetani, which is commonly found in soil, dust and contaminated objects. The bacteria can enter the body through tears or spits in the skin, burns and eye injuries. Tetanus is a preventable disease associated with a higher fatality rate. The treatment of tetanus is difficult and requires specialised, intensive care. Tetanus vaccination is an easily accessible and effective risk management strategy to prevent tetanus infection, especially in the outdoors. Tetanus vaccination is included under the Singapore National Childhood Immunisation Programme. Applicants are at significantly higher risk of tetanus infection if they have never been vaccinated or if the validity period of their tetanus vaccination has lapsed. Tetanus vaccination has a validity of 10 years and is compulsory for your child‚Äôs participation in the course.

questionListItems.title: How would my child qualify to do more demanding subjects?

answer.body: Beyond the start of Secondary One, students may offer subjects at a more demanding level if the meet the school-based criteria. These criteria include the performance in the specific subject being considered for higher-level learning, and a holistic assessment by the subject teachers and Class Mentors to ensure that the student can cope with the subject and overall workload. The school will guide and advise students on their eligibility to offer subjects at a more demanding level.

questionListItems.title: How will the school support my child if he/she does more demanding subjects?

answer.body: School will provide bridging and remediation where appropriate.

questionListItems.title: How is the subject class arrangement like if my child does more/less demanding subjects?

answer.body: Students take more/less demanding subjects in teaching groups like G1, G2 or G3. During these lessons, students will attend lessons according to their teaching groups.

questionListItems.title: Can my child switch back to the original subject level if he/she is unable to cope with the more demanding subjects?

answer.body: Yes, the school will holistically assess the student‚Äôs aptitude and attitude towards learning, his/her socio-emotional well-being, and the consequential impact on post-secondary progression options. However, it is recommended for the child to attempt any subject at a more demanding level for at least a year to better gauge his/her suitability to continue.

questionListItems.title: At what level does my child take the National Examination if he/she offers subjects at different levels?

answer.body: The student will offer each subject at the level that he/she has prepared for. Hence, it can be a combination of more and less demanding subjects as well as subjects that are offered at level. For the new Singapore-Cambridge Secondary Education Certificate (SEC) Examinations that will take place from 2027 onwards, the certificate will reflect the level at which each subject is taken.
